data.data: The minimum wage in China is based on the region or municipality. The minimum wage in Shanghai is RMB 2,590 and RMB 2,320 in Beijing.

The individual income tax ranges from 3% to 45%. Income tax is calculated according to progressive rates. Multiple additional factors may impact overall rates such as the household status and the number of children.
The employer cost is generally estimated at 41% of the employee salary.
Standard working hours are 8 hours per day, 40 hours per week. The standard work week is from Monday to Friday. However, this can vary based on the region.

Overtime payment is mandatory. Hours outside of standard work hours are considered overtime. Employees can work a maximum of 3 hours of overtime per day and 36 hours per month. If agreed by the employer, employees are paid the following rates for additional hours:

data.text: 150% of average salary for extended working hours
200% of average salary for work on a rest day (with no compensatory leave arrangement)
300% of average salary for work on statutory holidays

data.data: Pregnant employees are entitled to 98 days of paid leave. The leave is generally granted 15 days before the day of delivery. The salary during this leave will be the average salary of all of the female employees in the company, or 3 times the minimum wage (whichever is greater). Social Security is responsible for the payment amounting to 3 times the minimum wage. All the amounts above are paid by the employer.

Employees are entitled to 15 days of paid paternity leave. If the employer has paid social insurance premiums for employees, the Social Security Center is responsible for the salary payment during leave (once the employer applies to the Social Security Center). The salary during paternity leave is the local social average wage standard. If the employee's salary is higher than the social average wage standard, the employer shall make up the difference. Thus, the employee will receive 100% of their base salary.
The employee can extend leave using childcare leave.

Parental leave varies based on the region that the employee is based in. Employees in Beijing and Shanghai are entitled to 5 days of parental leave each year until their child turns 3 years old. Both parents can take this leave and decide how to distribute the time off. For specific salary settlements, most regions provide base salary during statutory parental leave.

data.data: Sick leave in China is very complex. Employees are entitled to paid sick leave ranging from 3 to 24 months. The length of leave and compensation varies based on seniority and length of employment with the same employer.
Sick leave renumeration will be treated on a case by case situation, as it will depend on specific factors relating to the employee.

Terminations must respect complex rules and the rules of an employee’s employment country. The off-boarding is always handled by the Employer with the primary stakeholders. It may include ad-hoc fees as well as required or recommended steps on specific termination cases.
Terminations in China can be complex. There is no at-will termination in China for employers, outside the probation period, and termination must be done for just cause.
Compliant terminations include:

data.text: Voluntarily by the employee under the following circumstances:

children.text: Working conditions do not conform to the law
The employer does not pay the remuneration stated on the employment agreement

data.text: Unilaterally by the employer under the following circumstances if the employee:

children.text: Withheld information (degree, qualifications, diseases) that can affect work
Caused damage to the company or neglects duties
Does not meet acceptable standards of work before or after being trained
Absent from work for more than 5 working days without the prior consent of the General Manager
Employed or engaged in other trade or business organization without the written consent of the employer
Had a conflict of interest that can cause harm to the interests of the company

data.text: By the expiration of the contract

data.data: The minimum notice period is 1 month and can be increased based on the employer’s discretion.
In China, severance pay is based on the length of employment with the same employer. It is paid at the rate of 1 month's wage for each year worked, rounded up to the nearest 0.5 or 1 year.

Full-time employees are entitled to 5 to 15 days of paid time off (PTO) a year, based on the length of employment. PTO accrues monthly, prorated based on their length of employment. Employees are eligible for annual leave after one year of employment.

data.text: Up to 1 year of employment - No PTO entitlement
Between 1-10 years of employment - 5 days of PTO
Between 10-20 years of employment - 10 days of PTO
20+ years of employment - 15 days of PTO

data.data: PTO for part-time employees depends on negotiations between the employer and employee.

Onboarding takes 5 business days.
Contracts must be in English or a national language (Chinese, Japanese, Korean, etc.) and can be bilingual. They must be in writing and signed by both parties.
A contract must include:

data.text: Remuneration, labor protections, and labor insurance

data.data: Probation periods are not mandatory. The minimum probation period is 1 month, and the maximum probation period is 6 months.
